trans-unit.source: Encapsulates the collection of checked items, including items in an indeterminate state, in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox"></xref> control.
The checked items collection is a subset of all items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox> control; it contains only those items that are in a checked or indeterminate state.
The following table is an example of the indexed collection of items in the control (all items contained in the control).
Index
Item
Check State
object 1
object 2
object 3
object 4
object 5
Based on the previous example, the following table shows the indexed collection of the checked items.
Index
Item
object 2
object 4
object 5

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox> class has two members that allow you to access the stored indexes, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection.Item%2A> property and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
Based on the previous example, a call to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection.Item%2A> property with a parameter value of 1 returns object 4.
A call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> with a parameter of object 4 returns a value of 1.
Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.
This method determines if an object from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.Items%2A> collection is in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItems%2A> collection.
An object from the items collection.
`true` if item is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.
You can use this method to combine the selected indexes from multiple collections into a single array.
The destination array.
The zero-based relative index in dest at which copying begins.
array is `null`.
array is multidimensional.
index is less than zero.
The number of elements in the source <xref href="System.Array"></xref> is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.
The type of the source <xref href="System.Array"></xref> cannot be cast automatically to the type of the destination <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
The number of items in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItems"></xref> collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> for navigating through the list.
Returns an index into the collection of checked items.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItems%2A> collection is a subset of the objects in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.Items%2A> collection, representing only items that are checked.
This collection is ordered in ascending order.
The object whose index you want to retrieve.
This object must belong to the checked items collection.
The index of the object in the checked item collection or -1 if the object is not in the collection.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection"></xref> class overview.
Gets a value indicating if the collection is read-only.
Always `true`.
Gets an object in the checked items collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItems%2A> collection is a subset of the objects in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.Items%2A> collection, representing only items that are checked.
This collection is ordered in ascending order.
An index into the collection of checked items.
This collection index corresponds to the index of the checked item.
The object at the specified index.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection"></xref> class overview.
The object cannot be set.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
`false` in all cases.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> used to synchronize to the collection.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Add(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add to the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref>.
The zero-based index of the item to add.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Clear"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Insert(System.Int32,System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which value should be inserted.
The item to insert into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
`false` in all cases.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.Remove(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The item to remove from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Collections.IList.RemoveAt(System.Int32)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
